I know what is like

I got to see the HPA axis response tine cycle, in a black bear and two dogs. 

When we surprised the bear, in a bush, right next to the trail, the youngest dog (my neighbor's) just took flight like it was launched from a sling shot.  My dog looked to me for guidance and I told her to sit and not talk to the bear.  She looked at me like I might be crazy, but complied. 

The bear stood up, 10 feet from us and was breathing hard.  I stared at my dog (as if I had no worry about the bear, at all, except for how my dog was behaving.  After about 60 seconds of playing us playing statue, I could hear (and see in my side vision) that the bear was calming down.  It took a step backwards and looked at each of us.  Did that again, and then just sort of shrugged and turned and walked away. 

We remained motionless until it was just about out of sight.  Then my dog gave me a look, like "Holy crap, how did you know that would work?"  And we went looking for the other dog.
